actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.
Reported to House from the Committee on the Judiciary with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1650.
Measure called up by consent calendar in House.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in Senate.

official_title: A bill to amend title 28 of the United States Code to provide that the requirement that each United States attorney and United States marshal reside in the district for which he is appointed shall not apply to an individual appointed to such a position for the Northern Mariana Islands if such individual is at the same time serving in the same capacity in another district.
subjects: Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on the Judiciary with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1650) Exempts United States attorneys, assistant United States attorneys, and United States Marshals appointed for the Northern Mariana Islands from the residency requirement if they are simultaneously serving in the same capacity in another district.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 28 of the United States Code to provide that the requirement that each United States attorney and United States marshal reside in the district for which he is appointed shall not apply to an individual appointed to such a position for the Northern Mariana Islands if such individual is at the same time serving in the same capacity in another district.
